availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William McGary Davis (Hopkins County, Kentucky, student and farm laborer.)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, student and farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Israel Davis and Dicey Woodruff Davis. Student in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860. Household owns five enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 61A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 800.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 218A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #13202.
"William McGary Davis (1840-1918)," Find A Grave, Memorial #25172663, accessed January 11, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25172663.
